result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Laquine Buycks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) under the following payment plan: $50/month commencing 1/31/15 and due the 31st of every month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

***November 11, 2014, Judge Timothy Witkovial, DECISION & ORDER JOC amended to reflect 13 days of sentence credit on Count 2.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Huber for treatment. Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Laquine Buycks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order GRANTING 13 Days Credit signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  jbs
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.

Defendant Marcus Laquine Buycks in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Marcus Laquine Buycks in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  4 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  Huber for treatment.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) under the following payment plan:  $50/month commencing 01/31/2015 and due the 31st of every month thereafter until paid in full.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.
FILED.

Defendant Marcus Laquine Buycks in court with attorney Andrew M Meetz.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:  DISMISSED AND READ IN 

AS TO COUNT 2, Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  PSI was NOT ordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-12-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus Laquine Buycks in court with attorney Andrew M Meetz.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant produces medical documentation requested for nonappearance at last scheduled hearing.  Bench Warrant previously issued and stayed by the Court is lifted by the Court.  Jury Trial scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Jury trial scheduled for 07-07-2014 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.
No reply from defendant.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Attorney Andrew Meetz in court.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Michael Lonski.  
Attorney Meetz informs Court that defendant contacted him to inform him that he would not be able to attend today's hearing due to a medical emergency.  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant issued and stayed until adjourned Pretrial Conference date of 05-27-2014 at 08:30am in Branch 22.  Court ORDERS defendant to provide Court with proof of medical emergency visit on adjourned date.

Defendant Marcus Laquine Buycks in court with attorney Andrew M Meetz.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Andrew Meetz has accepted the appointment as counsel for the defense on behalf of Marcus Buycks.  Action in this matter adjourned for Pretrial Conference on 05-06-2014 at 01:30pm in Branch 22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-06-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) ad

Defendant Marcus Laquine Buycks in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail has already been posted in this matter, therefore Bail Hearing has been removed from Court's Calendar. 
State's offer was read on the record, and rejected by defendant.  State's offer withdrawn.
Defendant has asked for new counsel in this matter.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for 04-14-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Marcus Laquine Buycks in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn. RESCINDED BENCH WARRANT IN FILE.  Defendant is admonished for appearing late.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.

Defendant Marcus Laquine Buycks in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Marcus Laquine Buycks in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
